title: How to Make Sunflower Seed Muesli Bars

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 180ºC/350ºF.
steps.description: Prepare the baking pan first by lining with baking paper.

steps.headline: Place the syrup, honey and oil into a saucepan.
steps.description: Bring to the boil gently, stirring frequently.

steps.headline: Reduce the heat of the saucepan and leave to simmer for about five minutes, until the mixture thickens.
Remove from heat and leave to cool for two minutes.
Mix the oats, sunflower seeds, rice cereal, sultanas and almonds.
Pour the cooled syrup over the bowl mix.
steps.description: Stir completely to coat all ingredients with the syrup.

steps.headline: Transfer the sticky mixture to the pan using your fingers and a large spoon and pat down firmly.
steps.description: Use the back of the spoon to even the slice out.

steps.headline: Place in the oven.
steps.description: Bake for 25 minutes, or until golden brown.

steps.headline: Remove from the heat and cool on a cooling rack.

text: Preheat the oven to 180ºC/350ºF. Prepare the baking pan first by lining with baking paper. Place the syrup, honey and oil into a saucepan. Bring to the boil gently, stirring frequently. Reduce the heat of the saucepan and leave to simmer for about five minutes, until the mixture thickens.  Remove from heat and leave to cool for two minutes.  Mix the oats, sunflower seeds, rice cereal, sultanas and almonds.  Pour the cooled syrup over the bowl mix. Stir completely to coat all ingredients with the syrup. Transfer the sticky mixture to the pan using your fingers and a large spoon and pat down firmly. Use the back of the spoon to even the slice out. Place in the oven. Bake for 25 minutes, or until golden brown. Remove from the heat and cool on a cooling rack.  Cut into bars when cool. Keep in airtight container.
